text.name: CVTAgui_underTitle
text.text: The engine temperature is not synced in the multiplayer.Please use DashboardLive for this

text.name: variantTT
text.text: Select gear variant, there are a variety of different stepless gears.

text.name: ui_alreadyAdmin
text.text: You're logged in as admin already.

text.name: text_CVT_notInstalled_desc
text.text: CVTaddon Not active, but vehicles are compensated for in acceleration.

text.name: drivinglevelTT
text.text: Number of possible driving levels. Different manufacturers and models have many variants.Fendt, for example, has two, JD three, Claas often three and two. (Vario coming soon)

text.name: accRampTT
text.text: Number of possible acceleration ramps. Different manufacturers and models have many variants.Fendt, for example, has four, John Deere three.

text.name: antiSlipTT
text.text: As soon as slippage arises on the wheels, the function intervenes and brakes individual wheels.

text.name: pitTT
text.text: Runs into the curve instead of sliding over the front axle.Real is only available at Fendt.

text.name: ipmTT
text.text: Intelligent Power Management Boost. A corresponding performance increase is given for overweak of 14 kph and/or switching on the PTO under load. This is a relatively modern version to keep the Emmision values lower and still have more power available if necessary.

text.name: inchingTT
text.text: The clutch pedal is used as an inching pedal. When pressing, the vehicle becomes faster or slower, even when the cruise control is activated.

text.name: reverseLightsTT
text.text: When driving backwards, the rear working light automatically switches on. Often to be found in modern and large machines such as harvest.

text.name: reverseLightsDurationTT
text.text: Time in seconds how long the light should remain switched on after reversing.

text.name: hstTT
text.text: HST or hydrostat Hydraulic transmission? HST No automatic engine speed, except for the idle control. Hydrostat is more automated on different variants and mostly has all-wheel drive drive and own, Depending on the manufacturer, even retail hydromotors.

text.name: brakeForceCorrectionTT
text.text: The effect of the engine brake is calculated dynamically and depending on various factors by the CVT add-on. With this setting, the resulting calculation can be influenced in a targeted manner and optionally compensates for a stronger or weaker braking effect.

text.name: drivingLevelStateTT
text.text: The maximum speed for lower driving areas or the HST and harvesting machines the limit ramps, are hereby reduced or increased.For example, a stepless vehicle with 2 driving areas drives the full speed (50kph) in 2, in 1 half (25kph). If you place this value on low, it would be 22 kph, very little then 15.5 kph.The same applies.Higher, 28 kph and very high 31 kph.

text.name: text_CVT_Installed_desc
text.text: CVT-Addon active and configurable in the GUI.

text.name: txt_vcaInfo
text.text: The low braking force was set in VCA to 100% and the engine modifications were deactivated.The latter can be activated again, depending on the vehicle, it works more or less.

text.name: txt_needClutch2start
text.text: Press clutch to start the engine.

text.name: txt_needBrake2start
text.text: Pull handbrake to start the engine.

text.name: txt_needNoHG2start
text.text: handgas out to start the engine.

text.name: txt_needpreGlow
text.text: Preheat necessary for the start of the engine!

text.name: txt_attCVTpressure
text.text: Attention, too high pressure in the driving rate.Temp. Watch.

text.name: txt_warn_tofastDn
text.text: Too fast!Change the driving level at a maximum of 10 kph, otherwise the gearbox is damaged.

text.name: txt_warn_tofastUp
text.text: Caution! Change driving levels at a maximum of 10 kph, it is best to stop briefly.

text.name: help_page_startEngine_text
text.text: The clutch must be kicked in stepless vehicles, So the same input which is also the normal coupling.With hydrostatic configuration, if VCA is active, The handbrake was pulled to start the engine. In addition, the hand gas must not be raised, it must be to 0.

text.name: help_page_DLimg_text
text.text: The left point shows the travel area I. The right point shows driving area II.

text.name: help_page_dl_text
text.text: There are 2 driving levels, II. is intended for road trips, transport and easy work. Level I. more for severe field work and heavy transports. The maximum speed is also reduced and the torque ensures more thrust, especially when starting. A key assignment must be assigned for each stage.Changing the driving areas should happen at a standstill, since damage can also occur here. *A little tip, if you use the group circuit buttons for high/down, you can use the same buttons for the driving levels. Special feature of the 'modern' configuration is that the driving areas are regulated.

text.name: help_page_AR_text
text.text: Furthermore, there is now an acceleration ramp in 4 stages that can be switched through with a button. Here the suit behavior when accelerating and reducing the driving speed is influenced.Gentle and with feeling or full power and rough. With heavy devices or trailers, there may be high pressures in the planetary gear and it can be damaged! Here the acceleration ramp should be set to 3 or less.Level 4 is more suitable for empty trips. In the light field work, you can still draw on speed 1 in the acceleration ramp 4 - for example, disc icons, flat grubber.

text.name: help_page_BR_text
text.text: In order not to indulge in comfortable setting options, you can also change the brake ramp. There is also a button with which can be switched into 5 steps. The brake ramp in different speed levels of 1 kph (standard) 4, 8, 15 and 17 kph, that when the driving pedal or driving joy stick is released, support the engine brake effect from the set brake ramp with the operating brake. This can be helpful for shunting or front loading work - or simply with stop and go road trips.

text.name: help_page_tmsP_text
text.text: The TMS 'Pedal' mode, with this you can control the pedal resolution.I.e. determine the maximum speed of the pedal. With deactivated cruise control, you set the steps there. Example 1 could be max 3 kph.The pedal then reacts in percentage, i.e. 50% pedal path corresponds to a maximum of 12 kph, 6 kph.

text.name: help_page_HG_text
text.text: Digital handgas, has easily only a decoration function-but together with another mod (radas), the rear hydraulic, PTO performance, etc. is then controlled.There is a special feature with HST and wheel loaders.

text.name: help_page_aDiff_text
text.text: Automatic differential lock depending on the steering angle and all-wheel drive depending on the speed in gear level I. For field work with additional automatic preselection in DL II. to DL I. In a modern CVT configuration, the all-wheel drive is permanently active and regulates itself. You can only activate the automatic axle differential lock.

text.name: help_page_HST_text
text.text: If a vehicle is configured as HST, there are two hydraulic drive types that can be changed through the former driving ranges 1 and 2. Here you should decide which type of vehicle has - in reality a vehicle cannot have both.

text.name: help_page_HST1_text
text.text: 1 is the classic HST, where the foot pedal is usually designed like a rocker or there are two pedals on the left and right, each for backwards and forwards. If you press the pedal for one direction of travel, the vehicle moves as a percentage of the pedal - but the engine speed remains unchanged (idle). This means that the maximum speed is not reached. The hand throttle must be used for this. At 100% hand throttle, the travel speed can still be operated as a percentage because it is a hydraulic drive. Furthermore, the performance of the front loader on wheel loaders depends on the hand throttle, i.e. the lower the engine speed - which is also the pump speed - the slower the hydraulic lifting cylinders move. In addition, the heavier a front loader tool is and the heavier it is loaded, the lower the hand throttle is set, the lower the speed when lifting it. Be careful, if the engine is still cold and you operate the front loader, the engine can stall.

text.name: help_page_HST2_text
text.text: 2 is the newer version, which offers many, many other variations depending on the manufacturer - but I won't go into all of them. In addition to a brake, there is usually only one accelerator pedal instead of two. There is also a joystick or something similar with which you can set forwards, backwards and neutral if necessary. If you press the accelerator pedal, the engine speed regulates automatically and the vehicle accelerates to the percentage of the pedal being pressed. Furthermore, the engine speed increases automatically as soon as the front loader is operated - as long as the accelerator pedal is pressed at least 0.001%. At 0% pedal position, the hand throttle must still be used to ensure a minimum speed. In reality it's a little different, but unfortunately it can't be implemented quite like that in the game mechanics.

text.name: help_page_HST3_text
text.text: Drive features: Either there are hydraulic motors directly on/behind the wheels or there is an HST transmission, which usually also takes over the AWD supply with a cardan shaft (if AWD is available). The latter is more of a newer variant. Older generation AWDs, especially articulated vehicles, use a hydraulic transmission at the front and rear. The stepless acceleration ramps have a slightly different function on HST's! The HUD then says 'HySt' - but it can still be switched from 1 to 4. These are the speed ranges for hydrostatic drives: 4 fastest, 1 fast, 2 slow, 3 slowest

text.name: help_page_HARVESTER_text
text.text: This configuration is the right choice for most modern threshers and shredders. Everything is very similar to the HST configuration, but there is a field mode and a road driving area - driving areas 1 and 2 represent this. In field mode it is also possible to use a corresponding input device, e.g. a joystick that does not center or a throttle with center, as a drive lever. In addition, the vehicles can simply be started in this configuration. But be careful if the hand throttle is still turned on and the engine is not yet warm. As with the HST, the acceleration ramps also serve as speed ranges.

text.name: help_page_manual_text
text.text: If a vehicle has a manual transmission, you can specify this here to use the engine warm-up function there. For vehicles that have several transmission variants to choose from in the shop, it is not possible to correctly read the transmission type. If you do not want the warm-up function on manual vehicles, select the No option.

text.name: help_page_electric_text
text.text: These vehicles do not need to warm up and have a different acceleration curve. With the driving ranges you have a slow and fast travel option. The ramps are used to adjust the power of the battery and how much is available to the traction motor at the same time. The higher, the more kWh is consumed.

text.name: help_page_keybinds_text
text.text: There are no buttons assigned by default; everyone has to set this up themselves.

text.name: help_page_keysInfo_text
text.text: For the clutch, the same input can be used as for the clutch that was set up for manual transmissions. The driving areas can also have the same assignments, such as those for the group switches.

text.name: help_page_cold_text
text.text: Engine is below 45°C and too cold for full throttle, max less than max RPM : 1.5 Example: max 2200 RPM : 1.5 = not higher than about 1460 RPM. Caution, too high engine speeds when cold drastically increase wear. Warm up by gentle throttle or slow driving without revving high. This function affects all vehicles.

text.name: help_page_warnHeat_title
text.text: High pressure in the drivetrain, heating up

text.name: help_page_warnHeat_text
text.text: Warning temperature, there is high pressure; at less than 50% load and less than 50% throttle or when you stop driving, it will deactivate once cooling is sufficient.

text.name: help_page_warnDmg_text
text.text: At the top a warning indicator that alerts you that the current acceleration ramp could cause damage.

text.name: help_page_critHeat_text
text.text: Red is the critical temperature warning. Better stop and let it cool down.

text.name: help_page_critDmg_text
text.text: Indicator for critical damage. Now it has suffered minor or major damage. To reset the lamp: let the engine cool down and switch the engine off and on again. If the damage was too severe and the lamp remains lit, the transmission electronics switch to safety mode, reducing acceleration and top speed. If switching off/on does not deactivate the lamp, repair the damage first, let it cool down and restart the engine.

text.name: help_page_wearTear_text
text.text: Damage does not occur immediately; wear increases gradually. If a certain level is exceeded together with other factors, actual damage can occur up to total failure. In reality, repairs or replacement of the transmission are extremely expensive – so be careful.

text.name: help_page_manuheat_text
text.text: For manual transmissions, if not disabled in the shop, the engine also needs to warm up first. There are 4 colors: Blue - cold, Green - ok, Yellow/Orange - ok warm, Red - too hot or too high RPM when the engine is still cold.

text.name: explanation_PosOf_HUD
text.text: Changes the position of the HUD or switches off. The setting and storage of each player.

text.name: damageWT
text.text: Please repair, the wear of the driving rate is above

text.name: help_page_HUDset_text
text.text: In the escape menu, settings with the tractor symbol, the position of the HUD can be changed or deactivated in 2 variants.This setting applies per player.
